Criteria that people use to guide attention when making choices, but not merely instrumental ones
Policies that are considered part of living well - they represent something the person wants to uphold, honor, or cherish
Detectable through certain markers:

They can articulate when the policy is/isn't appropriate
They resist automating or delegating the policy

This aligns with your insights about beauty as a natural attractor vs. instrumental attention.
